text: I find it funny how the OST is almost always the last consideration for a game, often just a thrown together last minute job, to tick a box. While it's not as important as gameplay, graphics or even sound effects in the game - I really wish triple A games would put more effort into OSTs looking at you COD and Ass creed.

text: This is a game that will be remembered for being awesome. The music is brilliant, the connection between the movie and the game is kinda meh, James Bond going on missions he never went to in the movie but nevermind, the levels were good. The sound effects for the guns were amazing. When me and some friends a while back tried to play multiplayer we realized how derp the controls were, gameplay is actually pretty retarded. I just had to hear this song though. DAT MUSIC.

text: Ah, the memories, the memories. Crazy how far Rare has fallen. They never were the same after Doak, Norgate and company left and formed Free Radical; just lost too much talent and didn't replace it adequately. I heard that Microsoft put them to work programming the Live avatars and Kinect sports, which is kind of pathetic.
